title.narrative: OUTPUT 20: CHILD AND FAMILY WELFARE SERVICES

description.narrative: Most vulnerable and disadvantaged girls and boys have access to services to prevent and respond to violence against children, which contributes to Access To Justice, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, girls and boys in Ghana, especially the most disadvantaged, increasingly benefit from an equitable and integrated child protection system.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Most vulnerable and disadvantaged girls and boys have access to services to prevent and respond to violence against children

description.narrative: In 2019, 9,986 girls and boys benefitted from child protection case management services. The first cohort of foster parents were screened and trained in five regions. In total 300 parents were trained, and 60 children placed with them. Essential guidelines and procedural documents have been launched related to the care reform initiative. Further, at least 37,676 adolescent girls (10 to 19 years) were reached with life skills, health information and support to complete their education. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
